actions.text: Referred to House Committee on International Relations.

official_title: A bill to amend the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 so as to provide for reductions in aid to countries in which property of the United States is damaged or destroyed by mob action.

summary.text: Amends the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 to prohibit assistance for 12 months to any country in which the President determines property of the United States Government has been willfully damaged or destroyed by mob violence, unless the President certifies to Congress that such assistance is necessary to the national security.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 so as to provide for reductions in aid to countries in which property of the United States is damaged or destroyed by mob action.
